pageContent:
Eduardo Casanova
Mexico City, Mexico
ed.wacc1995@gmail.com
linkedin.com/in/edwardcasanova
Summary
Experienced Full Stack Developer specializing in building elegant and scalable systems with a focus on
maintainability.
 
Core values:
- Humans over tools
- Ideas over dogma
- Critical thinking and general solutions
- Balance in the pillars of life
- Learning for life
- Mentorship
- Leadership comes from caring, supporting and then leading
 
By prioritizing humans over tools, I strive to create user-centric solutions that enhance the overall experience. My
passion for critical thinking and general solutions allows me to tackle complex problems creatively.
 
Quirks:
- I am a bookworm and a fan of the O'Reilly Editorial books. Here's my read list: (https://www.litsy.com/web/stack/
edca3899/read)
- I am a Polyglot (Node.js, TS, Go, Rust, Solidity, Bash, SQL, Ruby)
 
My motto:
 
"I believe true engineering encompasses design, architecture, and unwavering dedication. Through meticulous
attention to detail and continuous growth, I strive to exceed expectations and deliver exceptional results."
 
AWS:
- I've worked with tools ranging from simple EC2 deployments via Terraform, Pulumi and Crossplane to complex
ones using EKS.
- EC2
- Lambdas
- K8s
- Cognito
- DynamoDB
- MemCache
- VPC
- Amplify
- Route53
- IAM
- S3
 
Open source projects:
Eduardo Casanova - page 
1

- Kumo: # Your quick and easy cloud development environment (For now, only AWS compatible) -> https://
github.com/ed3899/kumo
- Gimwork: Technical task for a startup I applied. Basically backend in node using aws cognito for authentication
and authorization. MongoDB for the database and ReactNative for the frontend. Can't share because of NDA
Experience
Career Break
None
Nov 2022 - Jun 2023 (8 months)
I decided I needed to take my career to the next level. So I focused on developing skills mostly in the
SRE and DevOps area.
 
I deepened my knowledge of:
- Ansible
- Python
- Go
- Packer
- Linux
- Docker
- K8s
- Terraform
- Pulumi
- Bash
- Chef and Puppet
- AWS
 
It all culminated in my first open source project. Kumo
https://github.com/ed3899/kumo
Full Stack Developer
Sterling Capital Brokers Ltd.
May 2022 - Nov 2022 (7 months)
- Executing user stories to support Sterling’s core technical product
- Bug fixes and performance improvements
- Deploy AWS resources using cross plane. (K8s)
- Monitoring our EKS cluster
- Observability reporting with Prometheus and Grafana
- Tests to ensure quality releases
- Helping to refactor our existing platform to ensure reliability and scalability
- Improving quality assurance practices within my team
- Collaborating with senior team members to define, document and implement the software, software
development best practices, infrastructure as code, release/test automation, observability and
maintenance of SCB's Platform.
- Expected to have a broad understanding of SBC’s technical landscape and can contribute across the
various domains that comprise SCB’s technical landscape.
- Assist with system design and implementation.
- Make suggestions and participate in decision making regarding the team’s agile processes/practices.
Eduardo Casanova - page 
2

Junior Information Technology Consultant
THinK Best Practice
Nov 2020 - Mar 2022 (1 year 5 months)
Help businesses:
- Analyze their current tech stack and identify gaps in their IT systems
- Evaluate migration to clouds such as AWS or Oracle.
- Worked with multiple AWS resources such as (EC2, VPC, Lambdas, Elastic Beanstalk, CloudWatch,
DynamoDB)
- Design deployment diagrams(Terraform)
- Improve their IT security policies and controls
- Integrate with 3rd party SASS applications
- Data analysis, conversion and migration
Education
Zero To Mastery Academy
Software Engineer, Computer Programming
Jun 2019 - Jun 2033
This academy took me from nothing to being a lifelong computer science learner. I will always be
thankful to Andrei Neagoie for being my first sensei.
 
Its courses may appear basic but they are the entry point for a lot of beginners who initially appear
intimidated by the field of computer science.
Udemy Alumni
Software Engineer, Computer Science
Jun 2019 - Jan 2033
This site well packed with courses regarding almost everything in Computer Science.
Kode Kloud
Software Engineer, Computer Science
Mar 2022 - Mar 2033

Universidad Modelo
Graduate, Physical Culture & Sports Training
2015 - 2019
The graduate of the degree in Physical Culture and Sports Training must have the skills of leadership,
communication, respect for human life, high sense of responsibility and ethics, both in their work and
their community.
a) The ability to develop training cycles according to the physiological, biomechanical and specific
needs of an activity or sport must also be developed, respecting its development and competitive
stages.
b) Implement prevention and rehabilitation strategies in the treatment of injuries related to physical
activity and sports.
c) Conduct research in the field of physical culture and sports training.
Irlanda English Academy
English Language
2007 - 2012
- Learned English as a second language.
- Took an exam approved by the Cambridge University called the FCE.
- I also hold a TOEFL
